KB Interpretation
Ampicillin ........................ Resistant

Gentamicin , High Conc .. Sensitive
Susceptibility to high levels ( 500 ug / mL ) of gentamicin implies that susceptible cell wall - active antibiotics ( ampicillin , penicillin , vancomycin ) may be combined with gentamicin or tobramycin for synergistic killing of Enterococcus faecalis .
For Enterococcus faecium , only gentamicin is active .

Vital signs :
Normal

Normal

Normal
Lungs
Bilateral : expiratory crackles ( in the upper lobe on anterior auscultation , in the upper lobe on posterior auscultation , in the base ) , inspiratory crackles , noisy breath sounds ( in the upper lobe , in the lower lobe , in the base ) .

Normal

Plan
ANEURYSM OF OTHER VISCERAL ARTERY ( ICD9 442.84 , Working , Diagnosis ) ( now status post repair of superior mesenteric artery aneurysm )
Continues to improve oxygenation now on 3 liters nasal cannula .
Tolerating tube feeds with bilious refeeding at 40 ml per hour .
Out of bed in chair and tolerating well .
Continue current management per CCM and general surgery .
